channel.title: Electricity on Cameron's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Electricity on Cameron's blog

item.title: Estimating electricity impact profiles for building characteristics using smart meter data and mixed models
item.description: My paper “Estimating electricity impact profiles for building characteristics using smart meter data and mixed models” (Roach 2019) was recently accepted by the journal Energy and Buildings. Code for this paper is now available on GitHub at my 1801-mmme repository. References Roach, Cameron. 2019. “Estimating Electricity Impact Profiles for Building Characteristics Using Smart Meter Data and Mixed Models.” Energy and Buildings, December, 109686. doi:10.1016/j.enbuild.2019.109686.

item.title: GEFCom2017 tutorial
item.description: Update (28 January, 2020). I have decided to post the paper’s code in dedicated GitHub repositories instead of a tidied up walkthrough. Code, R markdown files and a preprint of the paper Reconciled boosted models for GEFCom2017 hierarchical probabilistic load forecasting (Roach 2018) can be found at my 1701-gefcom github repository. A dedicated package that includes the tidied competition data in .rda format can be found at my gefcom2017data repository.
